history.content:
The class is great! I took it with Garg and he's excellent teacher. The tests were some of the hardest I've taken here, but that's also very variable on the TA (the semester before had quite easy exams).

In terms of material it's very different from 161 (161 isn't even a prereq). The whole class is teaching you how to prove security of different cryptographic primitives and protocols (similar to NP-reductions in 170).

Btw is an official course number now - 171! :) It's being taught next Spring https://www2.eecs.berkeley.edu/Scheduling/CS/schedule-draft.html

In terms of material it's very different from 161 (161 isn't even a prereq). The whole class is teaching you how to prove security of different cryptographic primitives and protocols (similar to NP-reductions in 170).

children.subject: Depends on how well you want to do/the TA! PSets could be very difficult, around 3-8 hours for me if I wanted to get 100%. One thing that makes the class difficult is there very little material (past exams, other comparable courses online) to help study so I ended up just doing a lot of textbook problems to study for exams which isn't the most efficient use of time. Some people studied much less than me and still did fine though so it's kinda up to how much you want to put in. I'd say it's probably slightly less workload than 170 for the average student though.
Oh interesting! Ill keep that in mind when signing up for courses next spring! Thanks for the help!
Oh thanks for the response! Seems exciting! How would you say the workload is for the course?

history.content: If anyone has ever taken that course, how was it? As someone interested in computer security and currently taking 161, how does this class compare to 161 besides it being more of a P-Set class? Also does anyone know if this course will be taught sometime in the near future?
history.subject: Anyone ever taken the cryptography course(CS 194)?
